definitions.definition: The final stage of a game of chess , when there are few pieces left .
examples: Rooks become much more important in the endgame .

definitions.definition: The final stage of a game of bridge , when there are few cards left .
examples: You can't really use squeeze plays until the endgame .

definitions.definition: The final stage of any game.
examples: Being stuck with two V tiles can make for an awkward Scrabble endgame .

definitions.definition: The final stage of an extended process or course of events , especially with the implication of the imminent realization of a masterful strategy or plan .
examples: What's his endgame , do you think?

definitions.definition: The gameplay available in a massively multiplayer online role-playing game for players who have completed all of the preset challenges.
The thematic element of an advanced cryptic crossword puzzle, typically solved after completing the grid .

main_definition: ( chess ) The final stage of a game of chess , when there are few pieces left .
secondary_definitions: ( bridge ) The final stage of a game of bridge , when there are few cards left .
( by extension ) The final stage of any game.
( figuratively ) The final stage of an extended process or course of events , especially with the implication of the imminent realization of a masterful strategy or plan .
( video games ) The gameplay available in a massively multiplayer online role-playing game for players who have completed all of the preset challenges.
( crosswording ) The thematic element of an advanced cryptic crossword puzzle, typically solved after completing the grid .
